Jinghui Liu

Physics PhD Candidate @MIT

Projects

A list of my ongoing and past projects can be found here:

Tool development: Light activation

An optogenetics system in sea star egg cell to harness controllability in the mechanochemical machinery

Decoding complexity: Topological braiding and signaling information

Correspondence between information loss and topologically-significant braiding dynamics on cell membrane

Seeking principles: Turbulent organization of protein signaling waves

Spatiotemporal organization of a developmental signaling process from underlying topological structures

Future interests

Quoting P.W. Anderson, "At each level of complexity entirely new properties appear, and the understanding of the new behaviors requires research which I think I as fundamental in its nature as any other...". I find the most exciting research questions emerging at the intersections between living complexities and physical simplicities.
